amendment.description: After section 1, insert the following section (and redesignate the subsequent sections, and conform internal cross-references, accordingly): SEC. 2. FINDING. The Congress finds that the American people are exposed to mercury from industrial sources addressed by the rules listed in section 2(b) of this Act through the consumption of fish containing mercury and every State in the Nation has issued at least one mercury advisory for fish consumption.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 19 printed in the Congressional Record to insert a finding by Congress that the American people are exposed to mecury through fish consumption in every state of the Nation.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Welch amendment (A012) Failed by recorded vote: 169 - 249 (Roll no. 778).

action.text: Roll call votes on amendments in House
House amendment not agreed to: On agreeing to the Welch amendment (A012) Failed by recorded vote: 169 - 249 (Roll no. 778).
Amendment failed in Committee of the Whole
House amendment offered/reported by: Amendment (A012) offered by Mr. Welch.
